xxl.core.indexStructures
Class BPlusTree

java.lang.Object
  xxl.core.indexStructures.Tree
      xxl.core.indexStructures.BPlusTree
Direct Known Subclasses:
HilbertRTree, MVBTree
public class BPlusTree
extends Tree

This class implements a B+Tree. For a detailed discussion see Douglas Comer: "The Ubiquitous B-Tree", ACM Comput. Surv. 11(2), 121-137, 1979.

Nested Class Summary
 class BPlusTree.IndexEntry
          This class describes the index entries of the BPlusTree (i.e.
static class BPlusTree.KeyRange
          This class represents key ranges (i.e. intervals of keys).
 class BPlusTree.Node
          This class is used to represent leaf- and non-leaf nodes of a BPlusTree.
 class BPlusTree.NodeConverter
          A NodeConverter is used by the BPlusTree to convert the Nodes for I/O-purposes.
protected  class BPlusTree.QueryCursor
          This class uses an efficient algorithm to perform queries on the BPlusTree.

Field Detail

BLOCK_SIZE

public final int BLOCK_SIZE
This declares the block size of the underlying external storage. This field is initialized finally in the constructor by the value given from the user as a parameter. It is used to compute the maximal capacity of the tree's nodes.

See Also:
B_IndexNode, B_LeafNode

B_IndexNode

protected int B_IndexNode
This is the maximal capacity of the tree's index nodes (except the root), i.e. the maximal number of entries which a node can contain. Its value is the quotient of the given block size and the maximal entry size.

See Also:
BLOCK_SIZE

B_LeafNode

protected int B_LeafNode
This is the maximal capacity of the tree's leaf nodes, i.e. the maximal number of entries which a node can contain. Its value is the quotient of the given block size and the maximal entry size.

See Also:
BLOCK_SIZE

D_IndexNode

protected int D_IndexNode
This is the minimal capacity of the tree's index nodes, i.e. the minimal number of entries which a node can contain. Its value is: B_IndexNode*minCapacityRatio.

See Also:
B_IndexNode, minCapacityRatio

D_LeafNode

protected int D_LeafNode
This is the minimal capacity of the tree's leaf nodes, i.e. the minimal number of entries which a node can contain. Its value is: B_LeafNode*minCapacityRatio.

See Also:
B_LeafNode, minCapacityRatio

minCapacityRatio

protected final double minCapacityRatio
This defines the minimal capacity ratio of the tree's nodes.

dataConverter

protected MeasuredConverter dataConverter
This is a Converter for data objects stored in the tree. It is used to read or write these data objects from or into the external storage.

keyConverter

protected MeasuredConverter keyConverter
This is a Converter for keys used by the tree. It is used to read or write these keys from or into the external storage.

nodeConverter

protected BPlusTree.NodeConverter nodeConverter
This Converter is used to read or write nodes (i.e. blocks) from or into the external storage.

getKey

protected Function getKey
This Function is used to get the key of a data object. Example: 
 
 Comparable key = (Comparable) getKey.invoke(data);

createSeparator

protected Function createSeparator
This Function is used by the method {BPlusTree#createSeparator(Comparable)} to create Separators. The user has to initialize this field with a suitable Function.

See Also:
createSeparator(Comparable)

createKeyRange

protected Function createKeyRange
This Function is used by the method {BPlusTree#createKeyRange(Comparable, Comparable)} to create a KeyRange. The user has to initialize this field with a suitable Function.

See Also:
createKeyRange(Comparable, Comparable)

reorg

protected boolean reorg
Flag indicating if a reorganization took place.

lastQueryDisscriptor

protected Descriptor lastQueryDisscriptor
Contains last used Descriptor for a query.

duplicate

protected boolean duplicate
Indicates whether a B+Tree can contain Duplicates or not.

Constructor Detail

BPlusTree

public BPlusTree(int blockSize,
                 double minCapacityRatio)
Creates a new BPlusTree. With a default setting of duplicates = false

Parameters:
blockSize - the block size of the underlying storage
minCapacityRatio - the minimal capacity ratio of the tree's nodes

BPlusTree

public BPlusTree(int blockSize)
Creates a new BPlusTree. The minimal capacity ratio is set to the default value 0.5 (i.e. 50%). and a default setting of duplicates = false

Parameters:
blockSize - the block size of the underlying storage.

BPlusTree

public BPlusTree(int blockSize,
                 boolean allowDuplicate)
Creates a new BPlusTree. The minimal capacity ratio is set to the default value 0.5 (i.e. 50%) with the option to set duplicates

Parameters:
blockSize -
allowDuplicate -

BPlusTree

public BPlusTree(int blockSize,
                 double minCapacityRatio,
                 boolean allowDuplicate)
Creates a new BPlusTree. with the option to set duplicates

Parameters:
blockSize - the block size of the underlying storage
minCapacityRatio - the minimal capacity ratio of the tree's nodes

public BPlusTree initialize(Function getKey,
                            Container container,
                            MeasuredConverter keyConverter,
                            MeasuredConverter dataConverter,
                            Function createSeparator,
                            Function createKeyRange,
                            Function getSplitMinRatio,
                            Function getSplitMaxRatio)
Initializes the BPlusTree. NOTE: This method is used in the case that the tree has only one container. For multidisk storage the user has to use the method: (Function getKey, Container container, MeasuredConverter keyConverter, MeasuredConverter dataConverter, Function createSeparator, Function createKeyRange, Function getSplitMinRatio, Function getSplitMaxRatio).

Parameters:
getKey - the Function to get the key of a data object
container - the Container that is used to store the nodes of the tree
keyConverter - the Converter for the keys used by the tree
dataConverter - the Converter for data objects stored in the tree
createSeparator - a factory Function to create Separators
createKeyRange - a factory Function to create KeyRanges
getSplitMinRatio - a Function to determine the minimal relative number of entries which the node maycontain after a split
getSplitMaxRatio - a Function to determine the maximal relative number of entries which the node may contain after a split

the initialized BPlusTree itself

initialize

public BPlusTree initialize(Function getKey,
                            Container container,
                            MeasuredConverter keyConverter,
                            MeasuredConverter dataConverter,
                            Function createSeparator,
                            Function createKeyRange)
Initializes the BPlusTree. It initializes Tree.getSplitMinRatioand Tree.getSplitMaxRatio in the following manner: 
 Function getSplitMinRatio = new Constant(minCapacityRatio);
 Function getSplitMaxRatio = new Constant(1.0);
 return initialize(getKey, container, keyConverter, dataConverter,
         createSeparator, createKeyRange, getSplitMinRatio, getSplitMaxRatio);
NOTE: This method is used in the case that the tree has only one container. For multidisk storage the user has to use the method: (Function, Function, Function, MeasuredConverter, MeasuredConverter, Function, Function).

Parameters:
getKey - the Function to get the key of a data object
container - the Container that is used to store the nodes of the tree
keyConverter - the Converter for the keys used by the tree
dataConverter - the Converter for data objects stored in the tree
createSeparator - a factory Function to create Separators
createKeyRange - a factory Function to create KeyRanges
Returns:
the initialized BPlusTree itself
See Also:
(Function, Function, Function, MeasuredConverter, MeasuredConverter, Function, Function), (Function, Container, MeasuredConverter, MeasuredConverter, Function, Function, Function, Function)

initialize

public BPlusTree initialize(BPlusTree.IndexEntry rootEntry,
                            Descriptor rootDescriptor,
                            Function getKey,
                            Function getContainer,
                            Function determineContainer,
                            MeasuredConverter keyConverter,
                            MeasuredConverter dataConverter,
                            Function createSeparator,
                            Function createKeyRange,
                            Function getSplitMinRatio,
                            Function getSplitMaxRatio)
Initializes the BPlusTree. It initializes Tree.getContainerand Tree.determineContainer in the following manner: 
 this.getContainer = getContainer;
 this.determineContainer = determineContainer;
 return initialize(rootEntry, rootDescriptor, getKey, keyConverter,
            dataConverter, createSeparator, createKeyRange,
            getSplitMinRatio, getSplitMaxRatio);

Parameters:
rootEntry - the new Tree.rootEntry
rootDescriptor - the new Tree.rootDescriptor

determineContainer - a Function to determine the Container that is used to store a new node created by a split operation

dataConverter - the Converter for data objects stored in the tree

createKeyRange - a factory Function to create KeyRanges

Returns:
the initialized BPlusTree itself

separator

protected Separator separator(java.lang.Object entry)
It is used to determine the Separator of a given entry (e.g. IndexEntry, data entry, etc.). It is equivalent to: 

 return (Separator) descriptor(entry);

Parameters:
entry - the entry whose Separator is required
Returns:
the Separator of the given entry

getIndexNodeB

public int getIndexNodeB()

nodeConverter

public BPlusTree.NodeConverter nodeConverter()
Gives the NodeConverter used by the BPlusTree.

Returns:
the NodeConverter BPlusTree
See Also:
nodeConverter

container

public Container container()
Gives the Container used by the BPlusTree to store the nodes. It is equivalent to: 
 return (Container) this.getContainer.invoke(this);
NOTE: This only makes sense if the whole Tree is stored in a single Container. This method is used by the default NodeConverter. Therefore the user has to overwrite the NodeConverter if the tree works in multidisk mode.

Returns:
the Container of the BPlusTree

isEmpty

public boolean isEmpty()
Checks whether the BPlusTree is empty. The BPlusTree is empty if the rootEntry is null or the root node is empty.

Returns:
true if the BPlusTree is empty and false otherwise

getLastDescriptor

public Descriptor getLastDescriptor()
Gives last used Descriptor for a query.

Returns:
last used Descriptor for a query.

remove

public java.lang.Object remove(java.lang.Object data)
This method is used to remove a data object from the tree. It uses the method separator(Object)to get the Separator of the given object. Thereafter it searches in the tree for an Object with the same Separator. The method {Separator#equals{Object)} is used to check whether two Separators are the same. NOTE: In duplicate mode the objects are compared with o1.equals(o2)

Overrides:
remove in class Tree
Parameters:
data - the object which has to be removed
Returns:
the removed object if the search was successful, and null otherwise
See Also:
Tree.remove(Object,Predicate)

remove

public java.lang.Object remove(java.lang.Object data,
                               Predicate equals)
Calls remove(Descriptor, int, Predicate) whereas the target level is set to zero. The used Descriptor is the result of 

                                getDescriptor.invoke(data);

Overrides:
remove in class Tree
Parameters:
data - object to remove
equals - predicate determining if an object in the tree equals data and should therefore be removed
Returns:
the removed object or null if no object was removed
See Also:
Tree.remove(Descriptor, int, Predicate)

remove

public java.lang.Object remove(Descriptor descriptor,
                               int targetLevel,
                               Predicate test)
Removes the object which is specified by the given descriptor. First query is called: 
 
                Iterator objects = query(descriptor, targetLevel);
Then the first object which meets the test(Predicate) is removed from the tree and returned.

Overrides:
remove in class Tree
Parameters:
descriptor - specifies the query
targetLevel - the level on which the query has to stop
test - a predicate the object to remove has to fulfill
Returns:
the removed object or null if there was no such object

insert

protected void insert(java.lang.Object data,
                      Descriptor descriptor,
                      int targetLevel)
Inserts an object into a given level of the tree. If level > 0 data has to be an IndexEntry (this only makes sense for trees whose index nodes support Node.grow()).

Overrides:
insert in class Tree
Parameters:
data - the data to insert
descriptor - is used to find the node into which data must be inserted
targetLevel - is the tree-level into which data has to be inserted (targetLevel==0 means insert into the suitable leaf node)

pathToLeaf

protected java.util.Stack pathToLeaf(BPlusTree.IndexEntry indexEntry)
                              throws java.lang.UnsupportedOperationException
This method computes the path from the root to the leaf node referred by the given indexEntry. The path nodes are fixed in the underlyig buffer. If they are no longer required the caller has to unfix them. If the given node is not a leaf node an UnsupportedOperationExceptionis thrown. The method calls pathToLeaf(xxl.core.indexStructures.BPlusTree.Node) where node is the leaf refered by indexEntry.

Parameters:
indexEntry - the Index Entry which refers the leaf node
Returns:
the path to the leaf node refered by the given index entry
Throws:
java.lang.UnsupportedOperationException - if invoked an a none leaf node
See Also:
pathToLeaf(xxl.core.indexStructures.BPlusTree.Node)

pathToLeaf

protected java.util.Stack pathToLeaf(BPlusTree.Node leaf)
                              throws java.lang.UnsupportedOperationException
This method computes the path from the root to a leaf node. If the given node is not a leaf node an UnsupportedOperationExceptionis thrown. The method computes the key range of the leaf and then calls the method pathToNode(BPlusTree.KeyRange, int)(level=0). The path nodes are fixed in the underlayig buffer. If they are no longer required the caller has to unfix them.

Parameters:
leaf - node whose path is needed
Returns:
the path to the given leaf
Throws:
java.lang.UnsupportedOperationException - if invoked an a none leaf node
See Also:
pathToNode(BPlusTree.KeyRange, int)

pathToNode

protected java.util.Stack pathToNode(BPlusTree.KeyRange nodeRegion,
                                     int level)
This method determines the path from the root to a Node. The Node is specified by its key range. The level parameter is required to determine the target level. The path nodes are fixed in the underlayig buffer. If they are no longer required the caller has to unfix them.

Parameters:
nodeRegion - the KeyRange of the Node
level - the level on which the Node is
Returns:
the path from the root to the Node with the given KeyRange on the given level

aloneKeyQuery

public Cursor aloneKeyQuery(java.lang.Comparable key)
Searches for data objects with the given key stored in the BPlusTree. It calls 
 KeyRange range = createKeyRange(key, key);
 return query(range, 0);
. Returns the set of results as a cursor. If the tree is not in duplicate mode UnsupportedOperationException is thrown.

Parameters:
key -
Returns:
cursor
Throws:
java.lang.UnsupportedOperationException - when the tree is not in duplicate mode

exactMatchQuery

public java.lang.Object exactMatchQuery(java.lang.Comparable key)
Searches the single data object with the given key stored in the BPlusTree.

Parameters:
key - the key of the data object which has to be searched
Returns:
the single data object with the given key or null if no such object could be found
Throws:
java.lang.UnsupportedOperationException - when the tree is in duplicate mode

exactMatchQuery

protected java.lang.Object exactMatchQuery(java.lang.Comparable key,
                                           Predicate test)
Searches for the single entry with the given key stored in the BPlusTree which fulfills the given Predicate. The method query(Descriptor queryDescriptor, int targetLevel) takes over the search process.

Parameters:
key - the key of the data object which has to be searched
test - a Predicate which the found entry has to fulfill
Returns:
the single data object with the given key or null if no such object could be found

rangeQuery

public Cursor rangeQuery(java.lang.Comparable minKey,
                         java.lang.Comparable maxKey)
Searches all data objects stored in the tree whose key lie in the given key range [minKey, maxKey]. The method query(Descriptor queryDescriptor, int targetLevel) takes over the search process.

Parameters:
minKey - the minimal boundary of the query's key range
maxKey - the maximal boundary of the query's key range
Returns:
a Cursor pointing all qualified entries

query

public Cursor query(Descriptor queryDescriptor,
                    int targetLevel)
This method calls query(IndexEntry subRootEntry, KeyRange queryInterval,int targetLevel) which uses an implementation of an efficient querying algorithm. The result is a lazy Cursor pointing to all entries whose keys are contained in queryDescriptor. Initially query creates the correct parameters for the call.

Overrides:
query in class Tree
Parameters:
queryDescriptor - describes the query in terms of a Descriptor. In this case it has to an instance of Separator oder KeyRange
targetLevel - the tree-level to provide the answer-objects
Returns:
a lazy Cursor pointing to all response objects

treequery

protected Cursor treequery(Descriptor queryDescriptor)

query

protected Cursor query(BPlusTree.IndexEntry subRootEntry,
                       BPlusTree.KeyRange queryInterval,
                       int targetLevel)
This method uses an implementation of an efficient querying algorithm. The result is a lazy Cursor pointing to all entries whose keys are contained in queryDescriptor. Method creates object of type BPlusTree.QueryCursor

Parameters:
subRootEntry - the root of the subtree in which the query is to execute
queryInterval - describes the query in terms of a Descriptor. In this case it has to be an instance of KeyRange
targetLevel - the tree-level to provide the answer-objects
Returns:
a lazy Cursor pointing to all response objects

treatUnderflow

protected void treatUnderflow(java.util.Stack path)
This method is called after an entry was removed in order to repair the index structure.

Parameters:
path - the path from the root to the Node from which the entry was removed

treatOverflow

protected void treatOverflow(java.util.Stack path)
This method is called after a new entry was inserted in order to repair the index structure.

Parameters:
path - the path from the root to the Node into which the new entry was inserted

wasReorg

public boolean wasReorg()
Return the flag reorgand resets it to false.

Returns:
value of #reorg.
